results.adx_keywords: Louisville, Ky, Bank Shooting (April 2023);Louisville (Ky)
results.byline: By Kevin Williams, Amanda Holpuch and Campbell Robertson
results.title: Gunman Kills 5 Co-Workers at Louisville Bank on Livestream, Police Say
results.abstract: The police did not give a motive for the shooting in the Kentucky city but said that the gunman, who also died, had been a bank employee.

media.caption: At least five people were killed and eight others were injured in a shooting at a bank in downtown Louisville, Ky., on Monday morning, the police said.

results.adx_keywords: Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Decisions and Verdicts;Abortion;Mifeprex (RU-486);Abortion Drugs;Biotechnology and Bioengineering;Food and Drug Administration
results.byline: By Pam Belluck and Christina Jewett
results.title: Drug Company Leaders Condemn Ruling Invalidating F.D.A.’s Approval of Abortion Pill
results.abstract: More than 400 executives said that the decision ignored both scientific and legal precedent and that, if the ruling stood, it would create uncertainty for the pharmaceutical and biotech industries.

media.caption: A letter signed by senior executives of pharmaceutical and biotech companies condemned a ruling by Judge Matthew J. Kacsmaryk that invalidated the Food and Drug Administration’s 23-year-old approval of the abortion pill mifepristone.
media.copyright: Senate Judiciary Committee, via Associated Press

results.title: How Brian Cox Felt About That Big Episode 3 Twist in ‘Succession’
results.abstract: It was a pivotal moment for this series, which orbits his character, Logan Roy, a conservative media mogul and political kingmaker. Major spoilers ahead.

media.caption: “People are very nervous when they come to meet me for the first time because they think I’m Logan Roy,” Brian Cox said of his character in “Succession,” “and I’m not.”

results.title: Trump Ignores Deadline for Personal Financial Disclosure to F.E.C.
results.abstract: The disclosure will eventually provide the first look at the former president’s businesses since leaving the White House.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump has so far failed to file personal financial disclosures with the Federal Election Commission despite multiple extensions.

results.byline: By Gabriel J.X. Dance, Tim Wallace and Zach Levitt
results.title: The Real-World Costs of the Digital Race for Bitcoin
results.abstract: Bitcoin mines cash in on electricity — by devouring it, selling it, even turning it off — and they cause immense pollution. In many cases, the public pays a price.

results.title: DeSantis Pushes Toughest Immigration Crackdown in the Nation
results.abstract: The Florida governor is pushing an aggressive proposal to penalize those who aid undocumented immigrants and to track costs for providing them with health care.

media.caption: Gov. Ron DeSantis and Florida lawmakers have said the expansive legislation is an antidote to President Biden’s “open borders agenda” and a model for other states.

results.byline: By Helene Cooper, Michael Schwirtz and Thomas Gibbons-Neff
results.title: Leaked Documents Suggest Ukrainian Air Defense Is in Peril if Not Reinforced
results.abstract: A huge influx of munitions is needed to keep Russia’s air force from changing the course of the war, according to U.S. officials and newly leaked Pentagon documents.

media.caption: Russian police officers watching military aircraft fly over the Kremlin. Moscow could decide it is finally safe to unleash its prized fighter jets and bombers if Ukraine’s air defense systems are depleted.

results.title: Al Jaffee, Inventive Cartoonist at Mad Magazine, Dies at 102
results.abstract: For 55 years he created the fold-in (as opposed to, say, Playboy’s fold-out), giving readers a satirical double-take on whatever was going on in the news or elsewhere.

media.caption: Al Jaffee at work in 2008. In 2007, he won cartooning’s top honor, putting him in the company of Charles M. Schulz, Mort Walker, Gary Larson, Matt Groening and others.
